children.subject: Yes, at least in the case of readers. Those apps will probably be out a bit later.

Actually, GSI appointments in the summer are almost exclusively 20 hours/week.  GSIs generally teach a single section in the summer, whereas in the fall/spring they would teach two sections.

30 hour per week positions usually mean you teach a section and do some other work (such as head TAship).

40 hour per week positions are *possible*, where you teach 2 sections, but most instructors (well, at least me) don't want to do that, because it's a *lot* of work, and can easily lead to burnout.  Even the 20 hour position can get pretty insane for those 8 weeks.

+1 to Rohin. 

If you want the extra hours, volunteer for head TA / other work, but two full sections is not too wise.
Are GSI appointments in the summer usually 40hr/wk (100% time)? How common is it to have 20-30hr/wk TAs? (The latter seems unlikely in 61BL since there's so much lab time, for example.)

history.content:
Summer 2015 TA Applications are now open!


Please note: Deadline for EE and CS courses is  April 1, 2015

 

Online applications are located at:

https://willow.coe.berkeley.edu/PHP/gsiapp/menu.php

TA positions are available for EE 40 and CS 10, 61A, 61BL, 61C, 70, 160, 162, 188, and 375.

 

In order to apply to be an undergraduate TA, you must meet the following qualifications:

  1.    Be a continuing student who is not graduating this Spring
  2.    Be in good academic standing (i.e. cannot be on academic probation or have more than 2 incomplete grades)
  3.    Upper Division status when you begin teaching
  4.    Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher and maintain this GPA in the semester you are teaching
  5.    Previously taken the course, its equivalent or a more advanced course, with a grade of A- or better
  6.    Complete the 300-level semester-long pedagogical seminar on teaching in the first semester you are teaching
  7.    If you are an international student and Summer 2015 will be your first time being a TA, you must complete the Language Proficiency Screening Questionnaire by March 1, 2015. (Please notify catherinedang@eecs.berkeley.edu once you have completed the questionnaire.)

 

If you meet all the qualifications above and are interested in becoming a UGSI for the Summer 2015 semester, please apply as soon as possible. 

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact catherinedang@eecs.berkeley.edu
history.subject: Summer 2015 TA Applications now Open!
